item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Sorry," [Hamlet] said, rubbing his temples. "I don't know what came over me. All of a sudden I had this overwhelming desire to talk for a very long time without actually doing anything." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "I am not a glutton - I am an explorer of food" -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I know the look of an apple that is roasting and sizzling on the hearth on a winter's evening, and I know the comfort that comes of eating it hot, along with some sugar and a drench of cream... I know how the nuts taken in conjunction with winter apples, cider, and doughnuts, make old people's tales and old jokes sound fresh and crisp and enchanting." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "All sorrows are less with bread. " -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Robert Farrar Capon
item.description: "I like a cook who smiles out loud when he tastes his own work. Let God worry about your modesty; I want to see your enthusiasm." -- Robert Farrar Capon

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Laurie Colwin
item.description: "No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, the wisdom of cookbook writers." -- Laurie Colwin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Alice May Brock
item.description: "Tomatoes and oregano make it Italian; wine and tarragon make it French. Sour cream makes it Russian; lemon and cinnamon make it Greek. Soy sauce makes it Chinese; garlic makes it good." -- Alice May Brock

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "An idealist is one who, on noticing that a rose smells better than a cabbage, concludes that it makes a better soup." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "I have made a lot of mistakes falling in love, and regretted most of them, but never the potatoes that went with them." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin
item.description: "The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of the human race than the discovery of a star." -- Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dione Lucas
item.description: "The preparation of good food is merely another expression of art, one of the joys of civilized living…" -- Dione Lucas

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by James Beard
item.description: "I’m going to break one of the rules of the trade here. I’m going to tell you some of the secrets of improvisation. Just remember—it’s always a good idea to follow the directions exactly the first time you try a recipe. But from then on, you’re on your own." -- James Beard

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Ruskin
item.description: "Cookery means…English thoroughness, French art, and Arabian hospitality; it means the knowledge of all fruits and herbs and balms and spices; it means carefulness, inventiveness, and watchfulness." -- John Ruskin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kevin Taggart
item.description: "Bacon is the candy of meat." -- Kevin Taggart

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin
